newsitem.title: SWEDEN: P&U says '97 EPS estimates $0.10 too high.
newsitem.headline: P&U says '97 EPS estimates $0.10 too high.

text.p: Swedish/U.S. drugs group Pharmacia & Upjohn said on Thursday that a market consensus forecast for earnings per share of $2.35 for 1997 was about $0.10 too high.
P&U spokesman Jan Isoz said that the company's finance director Bob Salisbury had told analysts at a telephone conference that the consensus forecast on the market was slightly too high.
"The average forecast is around $2.35, and he (Bob Salisbury) said that it could be around 10 cents too high," Isoz told Reuters.
Isoz said that adverse currency effects would mean that 1996 would be a worse year than previously expected.
"We won't get as far in 1996 as we thought as far as EPS is concerned. That means you also have to downgrade 1997 (forecasts)," he said.
He pointed out that P&U did not expect its sales to grow faster than the market average until 1998.
The company's comments at the telephone conference led to a sharp drop in the share price. The share fell to 230 crowns at 1425 GMT from 249 crowns 25 minutes earlier.
